definition[0]: to become involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens
example[0]: The army will have to intervene to prevent further fighting.
example[1]: The police don’t usually like to intervene in disputes between husbands and wives.
definition[1]: to interrupt someone when they are speaking
definition[2]: if an event intervenes, it delays or interrupts something else
example[3]: He was just establishing his career when the war intervened.
definition[3]: if a period of time intervenes, it comes between two events
example[4]: In the six years that intervened, I saw them once.
definition[4]: to become involved in a situation in order to help deal with a problem
example[5]: The Federal Reserve Bank had to intervene to support the dollar  (=buy the currency to keep it from falling).
example[6]: The government may be forced to intervene in the pay dispute.
